To every argument of sin.
v4: But ah, this faithless heart of mine,
The way I know, I know my Guide;
Forgive me, O my Friend divine,
That I so often turn aside.
v5: Be with me when no other friend
The myst'ry of my heart can share;
And be Thou known, when fears transcend,
By Thy best name of Comforter.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Breathing Out And Breathing In
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Albert B. Simpson
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1 v6 c1 v7 c1

v1: O Lord, breathe Thy Spirit on me,
Teach me how to breath Thee in;
Help me pour into Thy bosom
All my life of self and sin.
v2: I am breathing out my own life,
That I may be filled with Thine;
Letting go my strength and weakness,
Breathing in Thy life divine.
v3: Breathing out my sinful nature,
Thou hast borne it all for me;
Breathing in Thy cleansing fulness,
Finding all my life in Thee.
v4: I am breathing out my sorrow,
On Thy kind and gentle breast;
Breathing in Thy joy and comfort,
Breathing in Thy peace and rest.
v5: I am breathing out my sickness,
Thou hast borne its burden too;
I am breathing in Thy healing,
Ever promised, ever new.
v6: I am breathing out my longings
In Thy listening, loving ear;
I am breathing in Thy answers,
Stilling every doubt and fear.
v7: I am breathing every moment,
Drawing all my life from Thee;
Breath by breath I live upon Thee,
Blesséd Spirit breathe in me.
c1: I am breathing out my sorrow,
Breathing out my sin;
I am breathing, breathing, breathing,
All Thy fulness in.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Breath On Me
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Edwin Hatch, B.B. McKinney
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1

v1: Holy Spirit, breathe on me,
Until my heart is clean;
Let sunshine fill its inmost part,
With not a cloud between.
v2: Holy Spirit, breathe on me,
My stubborn will subdue;
Teach me in words of living flame
What Christ would have me do.
v3: Holy Spirit, breathe on me,
Fill me with pow'r divine;
Kindle a flame of love and zeal
Within this heart of mine.
v4: Holy Spirit, breathe on me,
Till I am all Thine own,
Until my will is lost in Thine,
To live for Thee alone.
c1: Breathe on me, breathe on me,
Holy Spirit, breathe on me;
Take Thou my heart, cleanse every part,
Holy Spirit, breathe on me.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Fill Me Now
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Elwood H. Stokes
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1

v1: Fill me with Thy gracious Spirit,
Fill my longing spirit now;
Fill me with Thy hallowed presence,
Come, dear Lord, and fill me now!
v2: Thou canst fill me with Thy Spirit,
Though I cannot tell Thee how;
But I need Thee, greatly need Thee;
Come, dear Lord, and fill me now!
v3: I am weakness, full of weakness;
At Thy sacred feet I bow;
By Thy blest, eternal Spirit,
Fill with strength, and fill me now!
v4: Cleanse and comfort, bless and save me;
Fill my broken spirit now!
Thou art comforting and saving,
Thou art sweetly filling now.
c1: Fill me now! Fill me now!
Fill me with Thy Spirit now!
Strip me wholly, empty thoroughly,
Fill me with Thy Spirit now!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Even Me
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Elizabeth H. Codner
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1 v6 c1

v1: Lord, I hear of show'rs of blessing
Thou art scatt'ring full and free;
Show'rs the thirsty land refreshing;
Let some drops now fall on me,
v2: Pass me not, O gracious Father!
Sinful tho' my heart may be;
Thou might'st spurn me, but the rather
Let Thy mercy fall on me,
v3: Pass me not, O tender Savior!
Let me love and cling to Thee—
I am longing for Thy favor.
When Thou comest, call for me,
v4: Pass me not, O mighty Spirit!
Thou canst make the blind to see;
Witnesser of Jesus' merit,
Speak the word of pow'r to me,
v5: Love of God, so pure and changeless!
Blood of Christ, so rich and free!
Grace of God, so strong and boundless!
Magnify them all in me.
v6: Pass me not; but pardon bringing
Bind my heart, O Lord, to Thee:
While the streams of life are springing,
Blessing others, oh, bless me.
c1: Even me, even me,
Let some drops now fall on me.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Showers Of Blessing
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Daniel W. Whittle
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1

v1: "There shall be showers of blessing:"
This is the promise of love;
There shall be seasons refreshing,
Sent from the Savior above.
v2: "There shall be showers of blessing—"
Precious reviving again;
Over the hills and the valleys,
Sound of abundance of rain.
v3: "There shall be showers of blessing;"
Send them upon us, O Lord!
Grant to us now a refreshing;
Come, and now honor Thy Word.
v4: "There shall be showers of blessing;"
O that today they might fall,
Now as to God we're confessing,
Now as on Jesus we call!
v5: "There shall be showers of blessing,"
If we but trust and obey;
There shall be seasons refreshing,
If we let God have His way.
c1: Showers of blessing,
Showers of blessing we need;
Mercy-drops round us are falling,
But for the showers we plead.

v1: Blessed, mighty Holy Ghost,
Fill me to the uttermost;
Let my life Thy channel be,
Just a channel, Lord, for Thee;
Through me all Thy fullness pour,
Give me ever more and more.
v2: Blessed, mighty Holy Ghost,
Fill me to the uttermost;
Be it unto me, O Lord,
Now, according to Thy Word,
Let the life of Jesus be,
Ever filling, even me.
v3: Blessed, mighty Holy Ghost,
Fill me to the uttermost;
Cleansed and holy, pure and clean,
Let the life of Christ be seen,
Hold o'er me Thy gracious sway,
Every hour of every day.
v4: Blessed, mighty Holy Ghost,
Fill me to the uttermost;
For Thy love, Thy light, Thy pow'r,
Just a channel hour by hour,
Till my Savior's face I see,
Fill me Lord, fill even me.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Spirit Of God, Descend Upon My Heart
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: George Croly

v1: Spirit of God, descend upon my heart;
Wean it from earth, through all its pulses move;
Stoop to my weakness, mighty as Thou art,
And make me love Thee as I ought to love.
v2: I ask no dream, no prophet ecstasies,
No sudden rending of the veil of clay,
No angel visitant, no opening skies;
But take the dimness of my soul away.
v3: Hast Thou not bid us love Thee, God and King?
All, all Thine own, soul, heart and strength and mind.
I see Thy cross; there teach my heart to cling.
Oh, let me seek Thee, and, oh, let me find!
v4: Teach me to feel that Thou art always nigh;
Teach me the struggles of the soul to bear,
To check the rising doubt, the rebel sigh;
Teach me the patience of unanswered prayer.
v5: Teach me to love Thee with a virgin love,
One holy passion filling all my frame;
Thus all the riches of Thyself to prove,
My heart an altar, and Thy love the flame.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Channels Only
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Mary E. Maxwell
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1

v1: How I praise Thee, precious Savior,
That Thy love laid hold of me;
Thou hast saved and cleansed and filled me,
That I might Thy channel be.
v2: Just a channel, full of blessing,
To the thirsty hearts around;
To tell out Thy full salvation,
All Thy loving message sound.
v3: Emptied that Thou shouldest fill me,
A clean vessel in Thine hand;
With no pow'r but as Thou givest
Graciously with each command.
v4: Witnessing Thy pow'r to save me,
Setting free from self and sin;
Thou hast bought me to possess me,
In Thy fulness, Lord, come in.
v5: Jesus, fill now with Thy Spirit
Hearts that full surrender know;
That the streams of living water
From our inner man may flow.
c1: Channels only, blessed Master,
But with all Thy wondrous pow'r,
Flowing through us, Thou canst use us
Every day and every hour.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Jesus, Where'er Thy People Meet
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: William Cowper
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7

v1: Jesus, where'er Thy people meet,
There they behold Thy mercy-seat;
Where'er they seek Thee, Thou art found,
And every place is hallowed ground.
v2: For Thou, within no walls confined,
Inhabitest the humble mind;
Such ever bring Thee where they come,
And going, take Thee to their home.
v3: Dear Shepherd of Thy chosen few,
Thy former mercies here renew;
Here, to our waiting hearts, proclaim
The sweetness of Thy saving name.
v4: Here may we prove the pow'r of prayer
To strengthen faith and sweeten care;
To teach our faint desires to rise,
And bring all heav'n before our eyes.
v5: Lord, we are few, but Thou art near;
Nor short Thine arm, nor deaf Thine ear;
Oh, rend the heav'ns, come quickly down,
And make our waiting hearts Thine own.
v6: Command Thy blessing in this hour;
And as the Spirit full of pow'r
With life and vision fill this place,
That all Thy purpose we may trace.
v7: O Thou, our Head, our Life, our Guide,
May nought in life or death divide
The saints in Thy communion blessed,
That all Thy fulness be expressed.

v1: Christian hearts, in love united,
Seek alone in Jesus rest;
Has He not your love excited?
Then let love inspire each breast;
Members on our Head depending,
Lights reflecting Him, our Sun,
Brethren His commands attending,
We in Him, our Lord, are one.
v2: Come then, come, O flock of Jesus,
Covenant with Him anew;
Unto Him, Who conquered for us,
Pledge we love and service true;
And should our love's union holy
Firmly linked no more remain,
Wait ye at His footstool lowly,
Till He draw it close again.
v3: Grant, Lord, that with Thy direction,
"Love each other," we comply,
Aiming with unfeigned affection
Thy love to exemplify;
Let our mutual love be glowing;
Thus will all men plainly see
That we, as on one stem growing,
Living branches are in Thee.
v4: O that such may be our union,
As Thine with the Father is,
And not one of our communion
E'er forsake the path of bliss;
May our light 'fore men with brightness,
From Thy light reflected, shine;
Thus the world will bear us witness,
That we, Lord, are truly Thine.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: All Praise To Our Redeeming Lord
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Charles Wesley

v1: All praise to our redeeming Lord,
Who joins us by His grace,
And bids us, each to each restored,
Together seek His face,
Together seek His face.
v2: He bids us build each other up;
And, gathered into one,
To our high calling's glorious hope,
We hand in hand go on,
We hand in hand go on.
v3: The gift which He on one bestows,
We all delight to prove;
The grace through every vessel flows
In purest streams of love,
In purest streams of love.
v4: We all partake the joy of one;
The common peace we feel;
A peace to worldly minds unknown,
A joy unspeakable,
A joy unspeakable.
v5: And if our fellowship below
In Jesus be so sweet,
What height of rapture shall we know,
When 'round His throne we meet!
When 'round His throne we meet!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Blest Be The Tie That Binds
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: John Fawcett

v1: Blest be the tie that binds
Our hearts in Christian love;
The fellowship of kindred minds
Is like to that above.
v2: Before our Father's throne,
We pour our ardent prayers;
Our fears, our hopes, our aims are one—
Our comforts and our cares.
v3: We share our mutual woes;
Our mutual burdens bear;
And often for each other flows
The sympathizing tear.
v4: When we asunder part,
It gives us inward pain;
But we shall still be joined in heart,
And hope to meet again.
v5: From sorrow, toil, and pain,
And sin we shall be free;
And perfect love and oneness reign
Through all eternity.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Once By Nature
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Bob Brenneman, Rick Coleman, Barbara Coleman, Eric Larson, Tom Yau, Rosie Yau
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1 v6 c1

v1: Once by nature we were dead in sin,
In a world of utter discord;
But together God has quickened us,
Raised us up to sit together with the Lord.
v2: Thus with all saints we can apprehend,
All the vast dimensions of God.
Knowing Christ's love passes all we know,
We're together filled to fullness with our God.
v3: Now we know the purpose of our God,
Visible the mystery became:
Christ, the church, together now we see,
And together put the enemy to shame.
v4: For this cause we pray the Father God—
Strengthen Thou with might our inner man;
Make Yourself at home in all our hearts,
Root us, ground us in Your love and for Your plan.
v5: In the Body we'll be fitly framed
As the many members Christ supply;
Working in the measure of each part,
All by growth in love the Body edify.
v6: Now we're one His purpose to fulfill,
As the one new man of His plan.
Unto Him be glory in the church,
And in Jesus Christ forevermore—Amen!
c1: Jesus is getting us together,
Come and see the saints in one accord.
His love is knitting us together,
To the stature of the fullness of the Lord.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: God Be With You
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Jeremiah E. Rankin
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1

v1: God be with you till we meet again;
By His counsels guide, uphold you,
With His sheep in love enfold you:
God be with you till we meet again.
v2: God be with you till we meet again;
'Neath His wings protecting hide you,
Daily manna still provide you:
God be with you till we meet again.
v3: God be with you till we meet again;
When life's perils thick confound you,
Put His arms unfailing round you:
God be with you till we meet again.
v4: God be with you till we meet again;
Keep love's banner floating o'er you,
Smite death's threat'ning wave before you:
God be with you till we meet again.
c1: Till we meet, till we meet,
Till we meet at Jesus' feet;
Till we meet, till we meet,
God be with you till we meet again.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: How Sweet, How Heavenly Is The Sight
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Joseph Swain

v1: How sweet, how heav'nly is the sight,
When those who love the Lord
In one another's peace delight,
And so fulfill His Word.
v2: When each can feel his brother's sigh,
And with him bear a part;
When sorrow flows from eye to eye,
And joy from heart to heart.
v3: When, free from envy, scorn and pride,
Our wishes all above,
Each can his brother's failings hide,
And show a brother's love.
v4: When love, in one delightful stream,
Through every bosom flows;
When union sweet, and dear esteem,
In every action glows.
v5: Love is the golden chain that binds;
The saints Thy grace thus prove.
And he is glory's heir that finds
His bosom glow with love.

v1: Behold how good a thing
It is to dwell in peace;
How pleasing to our King,
This fruit of righteousness;
When brethren all in one agree,
They know the joy of unity!
They know the joy of unity!
v2: When all are sweetly joined
(True followers of the Lamb),
They're one in heart and mind,
They think and speak the same;
When all in love together dwell;
The comfort is unspeakable!
The comfort is unspeakable!
v3: Where unity takes place,
The joys of heav'n we prove;
This is the gospel grace,
The unction from above;
The Spirit on all saints is shed,
Descending swift from Christ our Head.
Descending swift from Christ our Head.
v4: Where unity is found,
The sweet anointing grace
Extends to all around,
And consecrates the place;
To every waiting soul it comes,
And fills it with divine perfumes.
And fills it with divine perfumes.
v5: The riches of His grace
In fellowship are given
To Zion's chosen race,
The citizens of heaven:
He fills them with His choicest store,
He gives them life for evermore.
He gives them life for evermore.

v1: I have found life's Giver, and the Prince of Life;
He has quenched my thirst, and vanquished all my strife.
He, my living bread, became my daily meat;
Death has died in me, Life's triumph is complete.
v2: In the Church, what glory! Far horizons glow!
And His Name all radiant on each brow doth show.
Christ doth breathe upon her, He's her living Rock,
Shepherd of His sheep all gathered in one flock.
v3: There one holy flame doth burn within each breast;
By one blood redeemed, in Christ they find their rest.
All their thirst He quenches from one living stream;
They in adoration lowly worship Him.
v4: There as Bread of life faint souls He ever feeds;
There each hungry soul may take whate'er he needs.
Lovingly He draws each soul that truly lives,
And in bread and wine Himself to them He gives.
v5: Gone is all the earth-taint through abounding grace;
Hear the song of triumph from the ransomed race.
All in glory shining, glory not their own,
Blended into oneness, they approach the throne.

v1: Church of God, beloved and chosen,
Church of Christ for whom He died,
Claim your gifts and praise the Giver,
You are washed and sanctified.
Sanctified by God the Father,
And by Jesus Christ His Son,
And by God the Holy Spirit,
Holy, holy Three in One.
v2: By His will He sanctifieth,
By the Spirit's pow'r within;
By the loving hand that chast'neth
Fruits of righteousness to win;
By His truth and by His promise,
By the Word, His gift unpriced,
By His own blood, and by union
With the risen life of Christ.
v3: Holiness by faith in Jesus,
Not by effort of your own,
Sin's dominion crushed and broken
By the pow'r of grace alone,
Christ, the holiness within you,
His own beauty on your brow:
This shall be your pilgrim brightness,
This your blessed portion now.
v4: He will sanctify you wholly;
Body, spirit, soul shall be
Blameless till your Savior's coming
In His glorious majesty!
He has perfected forever
Those whom He has sanctified;
Spotless, glorious, and holy,
Is the Church, His chosen Bride.

v1: The Church's one foundation
Is Jesus Christ her Lord;
She is His new creation
By water and the Word:
From heav'n He came and sought her
To be His holy Bride;
With His own blood He bought her,
And for her life He died.
v2: She is from every nation,
Yet one o'er all the earth,
Her charter of salvation,
One Lord, one faith, one birth;
One holy Name she blesses,
Partakes one holy food,
And to one hope she presses,
With every grace endued.
v3: 'Mid toil and tribulation,
And tumult of her war,
She waits the consummation
Of peace for evermore;
Till, with the vision glorious,
Her longing eyes are blest,
And the great Church victorious
Shall be the Church at rest.
v4: Yet she on earth hath union
With God the Three in One,
And mystic sweet communion
With those whose rest is won:
O happy ones and holy!
Lord, give us grace that we,
Like them, the meek and lowly,
On high may dwell with Thee.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: I Am Your Inheritance
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Titus Chu
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1 v6 c1

v1: What a wondrous fact, O Lord, that
I am Your inheritance,
All Your boundless riches need the
Church Your fullness to express.
v2: I am blessed with every blessing
In Christ in the heavenlies;
Chosen e're the earth's foundation,
Holy I am saved to be.
v3: By the precious blood of Jesus,
We have fully been redeemed;
All offenses are forgiven,
Grace and wisdom pouring out.
v4: Now the Spirit has been given,
Pledge of my inheritance;
Giving wisdom, revelation,
That Your Person I may know.
v5: With enlightened inner eyes we
See the hope of Your dear call;
Power of Your resurrection
Manifested now in us.
v6: Lord, as Your inheritance, we
Praise You now wholeheartedly;
We're Your Church and we're Your body,
Your fullness eternally!
c1: Oh! objects of Your love, what we have become,
Manifest Your riches—
The praise of Your glory!
Oh! objects of Your love, what we have become,
Manifest Your riches—
To the praise of Your glory!

v1: I love Thy kingdom, Lord,
The house of Thine abode,
The Church our blest Redeemer bought
With His own precious blood.
v2: I love Thy Church, O God!
Her walls before Thee stand,
Dear as the apple of Thine eye
And graven on Thy hand.
v3: For her my tears shall fall,
For her my prayers ascend;
To her my cares and toils be giv'n
Till toils and cares shall end.
v4: Beyond my highest joy
I prize her heavenly ways,
Her sweet communion, solemn vows,
Her hymns of love and praise.
v5: Sure as Thy truth shall last,
To Zion shall be given
The brightest glories earth can yield
And brighter bliss of heaven.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Here Is Love
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: William Rees, William Williams, William Edwards
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Here is love, vast as the ocean,
Loving kindness as the flood,
When the Prince of Life our ransom
Shed for us His precious blood;
Who His love will not remember?
Who can cease to sing His praise?
He can never be forgotten
Thru heav'ns everlasting days.
v2: On the mount of crucifixion
Fountains opened deep and wide;
Through the floodgates of God's mercy
Flowed a vast and gracious tide;
Grace and love, like mighty rivers,
Poured incessant from above,
And heav'n's peace and perfect justice
Kissed a guilty world in love.
v3: Let me, all Thy love accepting,
Love Thee ever all my days;
Let me seek Thy kingdom only
And my life be to Thy praise;
Thou alone shall be my glory,
Nothing in the world I see.
Thou hast cleansed and sanctified me,
Thou Thyself hast set me free.
v4: In Thy truth Thou dost direct me
By Thy Spirit through Thy Word;
And Thy grace my need is meeting,
As I trust in Thee, my Lord.
Of Thy fullness Thou art pouring
Thy great love and pow'r on me,
Without measure, full and boundless,
Drawing out my heart to Thee.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: I Am His And He Is Mine
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: George W. Robinson
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Loved with everlasting love,
Led by grace that love to know;
Gracious Spirit from above,
Thou hast taught me it is so.
Oh, this full and perfect peace!
Oh, this transport all divine!
In a love which cannot cease,
I am His, and He is mine.
v2: Heav'n above is softer blue,
Earth around is sweeter green;
Something lives in every hue
Christless eyes have never seen:
Birds with gladder songs o'erflow,
Flow'rs with deeper beauties shine,
Since I know, as now I know,
I am His, and He is mine.
v3: Things that once were wild alarms
Cannot now disturb my rest;
Closed in everlasting arms,
Pillowed on the loving breast.
Oh, to lie forever here,
Doubt and care and self resign,
While He whispers in my ear,
I am His, and He is mine.
v4: His forever, only His:
Who the Lord and me shall part?
Ah, with what a rest of bliss
Christ can fill the loving heart.
Heav'n and earth may fade and flee,
Firstborn light in gloom decline;
But, while God and I shall be,
I am His, and He is mine.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Come And Rejoice With Me!
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Elizabeth Rundle Charles
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Come and rejoice with me!
For once my heart was poor,
And I have found a treasury
Of love, a boundless store.
v2: Come and rejoice with me!
I, once so sick at heart,
Have met with One who knows my case,
And knows the healing art.
v3: Come and rejoice with me!
For I was wearied sore,
And I have found a mighty arm
Which holds me evermore.
v4: Come and rejoice with me!
My feet so wide did roam,
And One has brought me from afar,
To find in Him my home.
v5: Come and rejoice with me!
For I have found a Friend
Who knows my heart's most secret depths,
Yet loves me without end.
v6: I knew not of His love,
And He had loved so long,
With love so faithful and so deep,
So tender and so strong.
v7: And now I know it all,
Have heard and known His voice
And hear it still from day to day.
Can I enough rejoice?

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Jesus Loves Even Me
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Philip P. Bliss
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1 v6 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: I am so glad that our Father in heav'n
Tells of His love in the Book He has giv'n;
Wonderful things in the Bible I see:
This is the dearest, that Jesus loves me.
v2: Though I forget Him and wander away,
Still He doth love me wherever I stray;
Back to His dear loving arms would I flee,
When I remember that Jesus loves me.
v3: Jesus loves me, and I know I love Him;
Love brought Him down my poor soul to redeem;
Yes, it was love made Him die on the tree;
Oh, I am certain that Jesus loves me!
v4: If one should ask of me, how can I tell?
Glory to Jesus, I know very well!
God's Holy Spirit with mine doth agree,
Constantly witnessing—Jesus loves me.
v5: In this assurance I find sweetest rest,
Trusting, in Jesus, I know I am blest;
Satan, dismayed, from my soul now doth flee,
When I just tell him that Jesus loves me.
v6: Oh, if there's only one song I can sing,
When in His beauty I see the great King,
This shall my song in eternity be,
"Oh, what a wonder that Jesus loves me!"
c1: I am so glad that Jesus loves me,
Jesus loves me, Jesus loves me;
I am so glad that Jesus loves me.
Jesus loves even me.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: I've Found A Friend
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: James G. Small
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: I've found a Friend, oh, such a Friend!
He loved me ere I knew Him;
He drew me with the cords of love,
And thus He bound me to Him.
And round my heart still closely twine
Those ties which naught can sever,
For I am His, and He is mine,
Forever and forever.
v2: I've found a Friend, oh, such a Friend!
He bled, He died to save me;
And not alone the gift of life,
But His own self He gave me.
Naught that I have my own I call,
I hold it for the Giver;
My heart, my strength, my life, my all,
Are His, and His forever.
v3: I've found a Friend, oh, such a Friend!
So kind, and true, and tender,
So wise a Counsellor and Guide,
So mighty a Defender!
From Him who loves me now so well,
What pow'r my soul can sever?
Shall life or death, shall earth or hell?
No! I am His forever.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: I Stand Amazed In The Presence
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Charles H. Gabriel
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: I stand amazed in the presence
Of Jesus the Nazarene,
And wonder how He could love me,
A sinner condemned, unclean.
v2: For me it was in the garden,
He prayed: "Not My will, but Thine."
He had no tears for His own griefs,
But sweat drops of blood for mine.
v3: In pity angels beheld Him,
And came from the world of light
To comfort Him in the sorrows
He bore for my soul that night.
v4: He took my sins and my sorrows,
He made them His very own;
He bore the burden to Calv'ry,
And suffered and died alone.
v5: When with the ransomed in glory
His face I at last shall see,
'Twill be my joy through the ages
To sing of His love for me.
c1: How marvelous! How wonderful!
And my song shall ever be:
How marvelous! How wonderful!
Is my Savior's love for me!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: O The Deep, Deep Love Of Jesus
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Samuel Trevor Francis
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: O the deep, deep love of Jesus,
Vast, unmeasured, boundless, free,
Rolling as a mighty ocean
In its fullness over me.
Underneath me, all around me,
Is the current of Thy love;
Leading onward, leading homeward
To my glorious rest above.
v2: O the deep, deep love of Jesus—
Spread His praise from shore to shore!
How He loveth, ever loveth,
Changeth never, nevermore;
How He watches o'er His loved ones,
Died to call them all His own;
How for them He intercedeth,
Watcheth o'er them from the throne.
v3: O the deep, deep love of Jesus,
Love of every love the best;
'Tis an ocean vast of blessing,
'Tis a haven sweet of rest.
O the deep, deep love of Jesus,
'Tis a heav'n of heav'ns to me;
And it lifts me up to glory,
For it lifts me up to Thee.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: The Music Of Love
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Titus Chu
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: There is music in my heart, a song for Him I love;
There's a hymn upon my lips, of tender grace.
All my love's poured out on Him, loving until I am restored;
Loving Jesus till my heart is soothed and new.
v2: Though I'm weak and often fail, my love for Him is strong;
Yet I often seek elsewhere for happiness.
Still His love it draws me close, though I am fragile and so cold;
He will ever, always, hold me in His love.
v3: Though I think I am so strong, yet truly I am weak;
When temptations come my way, I am undone;
Still my Lord, He loves me so, even as I am full of shame;
Oh, He loves me, and He loves eternally.
v4: Disappointed oft am I, yet still I trust Him more;
When my spirit is so weak, I groan and sigh;
Then my Love refreshes me, and He whispers softly saying:
"I love you and I will never let you go."
v5: There is music in my heart, a song for Him I love;
There's a hymn upon my lips, of tender grace;
I will testify of Him, loving Him till I am restored,
Loving Jesus till my heart is soothed and new.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Whispering
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Titus Chu
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Oh do draw me dearest Lord,
I will follow close to You.
You're so full so boundless, Lord;
More than I could hope to know.
Like a pretty henna flow'r
Blooming in the barren field;
As the myrrh with fragrance sweet
Deeply in my heart concealed.
Oh, do hear my whisper, Lord,
There's no other Lord but You.
As Your riches I partake,
In Your life, mature I'll be.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: You Are Fresh As The Dew
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Titus Chu
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: You are fresh as the dew of the morning, Lord;
Like a stream flowing free, You supply my need.
Lord, I open my heart to You, my beloved One;
Whisp'ring all of my thoughts, bathing in Your love.
v2: How can I fully say what is in my heart,
When You pour out Your love fully unto me?
Like a fountain of water, Your love my spirit fills;
Like a bright flame of fire, in my bosom burns.
v3: Come and burn all away that is not of You,
Burn away all the dross of the earthly loves.
Let me be whiter than the snow in Your love, dear Lord;
Let me live in Yourself, Your unblemished love.
v4: I'm in You; I am filled with Your life of love;
Of our union in love, I will testify.
All my strength, all my weakness is swallowed in Your love;
My dear Lord, now I live by Your love divine.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Enraptured In Your Love
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Titus Chu
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Enraptured in Your love— how fresh and new!
Infuse me with Your love— sweeter, fresher than dew!
Your love (embrace me close) does forward guide;
I revel in Your love, on Your breast abide.
How I yearn, O Lord, to delight in love,
By Your love o'ershadow me.
A banner over me: Your love— Yourself,
For Your love and Yourself are one.
v2: You are my dearest One, my only Love.
Yes, Lord, now You alone are the object of love.
If You redemption give and only love,
I know my heart won't be fully satisfied.
How I yearn, dear Lord, Your own self to gain,
For I know it's only You.
It's You that I pursue, and You are love;
My sole Treasure You are to me.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Let Me Love Thee
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Herbert H. Booth
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Let me love Thee, Thou art claiming
Every feeling of my soul;
Let that love, in pow'r prevailing,
Render Thee my life, my all.
For life's burdens they are easy,
And life's sorrows lose their sting,
If they're carried, Lord, to please Thee,
If their pain Thy smile should win.
v2: Let me love Thee, come revealing
All Thy love has done for me;
Help my heart, so unbelieving,
By the sight of Calvary.
Let me see Thy love despising
All the shame my sins had brought;
By Thy torments realizing
What a price my pardon bought.
v3: Let me love Thee, I am gladdest
When I'm loving Thee, the best;
For in sunshine or in sadness
I can find in Thee a rest.
But without Thee life is fading,
Treasureless its choicest flow'rs;
Taken are its gifts eternal;
Left, its empty passing hours.
v4: Let me love Thee; love is mighty,
Swaying realms of deed and thought;
By it I shall walk uprightly,
I shall serve Thee as I ought.
Love will soften every sorrow,
Love will lighten every care,
Love unquestioning will follow,
Love will triumph, love will dare.
c1: Let me love Thee, Savior,
Take my heart forever;
Nothing but Thy favor
My soul can satisfy.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: My Jesus, I Love Thee
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: William R. Featherstone
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: My Jesus, I love Thee, I know Thou art mine;
For Thee all the follies of sin I resign;
My gracious Redeemer, my Savior art Thou,
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, 'tis now.
v2: I love Thee, because Thou hast first loved me,
And purchased my pardon on Calvary's tree;
I love Thee for wearing the thorns on Thy brow;
If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, 'tis now.
v3: I'll love Thee in life, I will love Thee in death,
And praise Thee as long as Thou lendest me breath;
And say when the death dew lies cold on my brow,
"If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, 'tis now."
v4: In ages eternal of endless delight
I'll ever adore Thee in glory so bright;
I'll sing with the glittering crown on my brow,
"If ever I loved Thee, my Jesus, 'tis now."

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: I Love My Lord
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Jeanne Marie Guyon
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: I love my Lord, but with no love of mine,
For I have none to give;
I love Thee, Lord, but all the love is Thine,
For by Thy love I live.
I am as nothing, and rejoice to be
Emptied, and lost, and swallowed up in Thee.
v2: Thou, Lord, alone, art all Thy children need,
And there is none beside;
From Thee the streams of blessedness proceed,
In Thee the blessed abide.
Fountain of life, and all-abounding grace,
Our source, our center, and our dwelling place.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Highest Enjoyment
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Titus Chu
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Many nights while on my bed,
I sought Him whom my soul loved for years;
I sought Him, but I found Him not,
I should go out and seek.
O brothers would you tell me please,
Where did my heart's beloved go?
That I may run and bring Him back,
His love to enjoy once again.
Brothers, lead me. You are my guides
That in fellowship true I'd abide.
Oh! My love is now by my side,
Never from me did hide.
v2: Oh, how could I be Your belov'd,
Filled with Spirit like pillars of smoke?
Resurrected, to death conformed,
Myrrh and frankincense show.
O how could I be Your palanquin,
That through me You may move and rest?
As one of Israel's mighty men,
From terror to guard in the night.
All around me are those who watch,
I am safe and securely I dwell.
Love, immeasur'able, poured on me,
In Your likeness I'm formed.
v3: To the mountain of myrrh I go,
All that's mine I put to death;
Hill of frankincense I'd ascend,
Shadows flee away.
My beauty You proclaimed most fair,
The best love You enjoyed from me;
Your heart I've ravished with one glance,
My ointments excelling all spices.
Lebanon, I come willingly,
Called to live in ascension with Him;
Yet in Hermon I'll also dwell,
As I boast in Your cross.
v4: May the honey from my lips
Be for You the sweetness of love.
May the fragrance of Lebanon
From my living outflow.
O Lord, I beg You, quickly come,
My being's occupied by You,
A garden closed, a spring shut up,
A fountain sealed all for Yourself.
Wake, O north wind and come, O south,
From my garden the spices do flow,
To Your garden O come, Belov'd,
All its fruit to enjoy.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: A Whisper Of Love
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Titus Chu
Songs and Hymns of Life.music: Martini il Tedesco, from Plaisirs d'amour
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: How I desire to love You with all my heart
So that my spirit is flooded with love for You.
v2: How I desire to taste the sweetness of love
So satisfied in love's wonderful melody.
v3: How I desire to know Your most loving Self
So my heart can be united with heav'nly love.
v4: How I desire to fully belong to You
So I will only abide in Your love's sweet rest.
v5: How I desire to love You with all my being
So I can share in the secret of love fore'er.
v6: How I desire to mingle with You in love
So fully one in the journey of love with You.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Something Every Heart Is Loving
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Gerhard Tersteegan, Emma Frances Shuttleworth Bevan
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Something every heart is loving;
If not Jesus none can rest;
Lord, my heart to Thee is given;
Take it for it loves Thee best.
v2: Thus I cast the world behind me;
Jesus most beloved shall be;
Beauteous more than all things beauteous,
He alone is joy to me.
v3: Bright with all eternal radiance
Is the glory of Thy face;
Thou art loving, sweet, and tender,
Full of pity, full of grace.
v4: When I hated, Thou didst love me,
Shedd'st for me Thy precious blood;
Still Thou lovest, lovest ever,
Shall I not love Thee, my God?
v5: Keep my heart still faithful to Thee,
That my earthly life may be
But a shadow to that glory
Of my hidden life in Thee.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: In The Heart Of Jesus
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Alice M. Pugh
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: In the heart of Jesus there is love for you,
Love most pure and tender, love most deep and true;
Why should you be lonely, why for friendship sigh,
When the heart of Jesus has a full supply?
v2: In the mind of Jesus there is thought for you,
Warm as summer sunshine, sweet as morning dew;
Why should you be fearful, why take anxious thought,
Since the mind of Jesus cares for those He bought?
v3: In the field of Jesus there is work for you;
Such as even angels might rejoice to do;
Why stand idly sighing for some lifework grand,
While the field of Jesus seeks your reaping hand?
v4: In the church of Jesus there's a place for you;
Glorious, bright, and joyous, right and peaceful too;
Why then, like a wand'rer, roam with weary pace,
If the church of Jesus holds for you a place?

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Here I Am To Worship
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Tim Hughes
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Light of the world, You stepped down into darkness,
opened my eyes, let me see.
Beauty that made this heart adore You,
hope of a life spent with You.
v2: King of all days, oh so highly exalted,
glorious in heaven above.
Humbly You came to the earth You created,
all for love's sake became poor.
c1: Here I am to worship, here I am to bow down,
here I am to say that You're my God.
You're altogether lovely, altogether worthy,
altogether wonderful to me.
And I'll never know how much it cost
to see my sin upon that cross.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: O, Who's Like Our Jesus
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Unknown
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: O, who's like our Jesus? He's all we desire!
His love draws us near, sets our spirits afire!
We cannot but love Him— as one we proclaim:
"Lord Jesus we love Thee— exalt Thy dear name!"
v2: O Jesus, our Jesus, with Thee we are blest—
Our Life, our Enjoyment, our Peace and our Rest:
Thy name be our theme, and Thy love be our song;
Thy love has inspired both our heart and our tongue!
v3: O Jesus, our Jesus, how can we express
Thy dearness, so precious, and Thy loveliness?
When we see Thy beauty, all else fades away—
All shadows must flee at the breaking of day!
v4: We love Thee, we love Thee, we love Thee, O Lord.
We love Thee, our Jesus, we love Thee, our God!
We love Thee, we love Thee, and that Thou dost know;
As we're in Thy presence, love for Thee will grow!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: O Jesus Christ, Grow Thou In Me
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Johann C. Laveter, Elizabeth L. Smith
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: O Jesus Christ, grow Thou in me,
And all things else recede;
My heart be daily nearer Thee,
From sin be daily freed.
v2: In Thy bright beams which on me fall,
Fade every evil thought;
That I am nothing, Thou art all,
I would be daily taught.
v3: More of Thy glory let me see,
Thou Holy, Wise, and True;
I would Thy living image be,
In joy and sorrow too.
v4: Fill me with gladness from above,
Hold me by strength divine;
Lord, let the glow of Thy great love
Through all my being shine.
v5: Make this poor self grow less and less,
Be Thou my life and aim;
Oh, make me daily through Thy grace
More meet to bear Thy name.
c1: Each day let Thy supporting might
My weakness still embrace;
My darkness vanish in Thy light,
Thy life my death efface.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Higher Ground
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Johnson Oatman Jr.
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: I'm pressing on the upward way,
New heights I'm gaining every day;
Still praying as I onward bound,
"Lord, plant my feet on higher ground."
v2: My heart has no desire to stay
Where doubts arise and fears dismay;
Though some may dwell where these abound,
My prayer, my aim, is higher ground.
v3: I want to live above the world,
Though Satan's darts at me are hurled;
For faith has caught the joyful sound,
The song of saints on higher ground.
v4: I want to scale the utmost height
And catch a gleam of glory bright;
But still I'll pray till heav'n I've found,
"Lord, lead me on to higher ground."
c1: Lord, lift me up, and let me stand
By faith on heaven's tableland;
A higher plane than I have found,
Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Savior, Lead Me Up The Mountain
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: William J. Pearson
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Savior, lead me up the mountain,
Where the Lord alone is seen,
Where we hear the voice from heaven,
Where the air is pure and clean.
v2: Higher up where light increases,
Far above all earthly strife,
Where the strain of effort ceases,
Where in Christ we reign in Life.
v3: Savior, keep me up the mountain
Pressing on toward the goal,
Till, as one, we share Thine image,
And Thy love and grace extol.
c1: Lead me higher up the mountain,
Give me fellowship with Thee;
In Thy light I see the fountain,
And the blood it cleanses me.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: My Goal Is God Himself
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Frances Brook
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: My goal is God Himself, not joy, nor peace,
Nor even blessing, but Himself, my God;
'Tis His to lead me there— not mine but His—
At any cost, dear Lord, by any road.
v2: So faith bounds forward to its goal in God,
And love can trust her Lord to lead her there;
Upheld by Him, my soul is foll'wing hard
Till God hath full fulfilled my deepest prayer.
v3: No matter if the way be sometimes dark,
No matter though the cost be oft-times great,
He knoweth how I best shall reach the mark,
The way that leads to Him must needs be strait.
v4: One thing I know, I cannot say Him nay;
One thing I do, I press towards my Lord;
My God, my glory here, from day to day,
And in the glory there my Great Reward.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Come, Jesus Lord, With Holy Fire
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Charles Wesley
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Come, Jesus Lord, with holy fire,
Come, and my quickened heart inspire,
My conscience purged by blood;
Now to my soul Thyself reveal,
Thy mighty working let me feel,
Since I am born of God.
v2: Let nothing now my heart divide,
Since with Thee I am crucified,
And live to God in Thee.
Dead to the world and all its toys,
Its idle pomp and fading joys,
Jesus, my glory be.
v3: Now with a quenchless thirst inspire,
A longing, infinite desire,
And fill my craving heart.
Less than Thyself, oh, do not give,
In might Thyself within me live;
Come, all Thou hast and art.
v4: My will be swallowed up in Thee,
Light in Thy light still may I see
In Thine unclouded face:
Called the full strength of trust to prove,
Let all my quickened heart be love,
My spotless life be praise.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Come In, O Come!
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Handley C. G. Moule
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Come in, O come! the door stands open now;
I knew Thy voice; Lord Jesus it was Thou.
The sun has set long since; the storms begin;
'Tis time for Thee, my Savior, O come in!
v2: Alas, ill-ordered shows the dreary room;
The household stuff lies heaped amidst the gloom,
The table empty stands, the couch undressed;
Ah, what a welcome for th' Eternal Guest!
v3: Yet welcome, and tonight; this doleful scene
Is e'en itself my cause to hail Thee in;
This dark confusion e'en at once demands
Thine own bright presence, Lord, and ord'ring hands.
v4: I seek no more to alter things, or mend,
Before the coming of so great a Friend;
All were at best unseemly; and 'twere ill
Beyond all else to keep Thee waiting still.
v5: Come, not to find, but make this troubled heart
A dwelling worthy of Thee as Thou art;
To chase the gloom, the terror, and the sin:
Come, all Thyself, yea come, Lord Jesus, in!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: O Light Of Light, Shine In!
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Horatius Bonar
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1 v6 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: O Light of light, shine in!
Cast out this night of sin,
Create true day within:
O Light of light, shine in!
v2: O Joy of joys, come in!
End Thou this grief of sin,
Create calm peace within:
O Joy of joys, come in!
v3: O Life of life, pour in!
Expel this death of sin,
Awake true life within:
O Life of life, pour in!
v4: O Love of love, flow in!
This hateful root of sin
Deal with, renew, within:
O Love of love, flow in!
v5: O Heaven of heavens, descend!
This cloudy curtain rend,
And all earth's turmoil end:
O Heaven of heavens descend!
v6: My God and Lord, O come!
Of joys the Joy and Sum,
Make in this heart Thy home:
My God and Lord, O come!
c1: O Light, all light excelling,
Make my heart Thy dwelling;
O Joy, all grief dispelling,
To my poor heart come in!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Oh, Tame Me Lord!
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Catherine Booth-Clibborn
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Oh, tame me, Lord! rebellious nature calm,
Oh, tame me, Lord!
This heart, so tossed and filled with wild alarm,
Oh, tame me, Lord!
These human longings, let them end in Thee,
And let me be Thy bond-slave, even me!
v2: I will not ask Thee to account to me
For aught Thou dost;
For crosses sore, or paths I cannot see:
But I will trust.
No second causes shall perplex my soul,
Or stay from yielding all to Thy control.
v3: The raging storm I dare not fight alone,
Ah, show Thy face! Say,
"It is I!" Thyself to me make known,
Ah, show Thy face!
Then what care I for darkest depths of woe?
Thine arms, O Christ, shall fold me close, I know!
v4: Oh, save me, Lord! Subdue this stubborn will;
Oh, save me, Lord!
In spite of all, Thy purposes fulfill
In me, O Lord;
I yield myself, and all I have and am,
To follow Thee, Thou all redeeming Lamb!
v5: How can I fear? Thou art so near to me;
How can I fear?
I hear Thee say, "Believe, and thou shalt see!"
How can I fear?
I now believe, and trust Thy mighty power,
To save, to heal, to keep this very hour!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: I Need Thee Every Hour
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Annie S. Hawks, Robert Lowry
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: I need Thee every hour,
Most gracious Lord;
No tender voice like Thine
Can peace afford.
v2: I need Thee every hour,
Stay Thou near by;
Temptations lose their pow'r
When Thou art nigh.
v3: I need Thee every hour,
In joy or pain;
Come quickly and abide,
Or life is vain.
v4: I need Thee every hour,
Teach me Thy will;
And Thy rich promises
In me fulfill.
v5: I need Thee every hour,
Most Holy One;
Oh, make me Thine indeed,
Thou blesséd Son.
c1: I need Thee, Oh, I need Thee;
Every hour I need Thee;
Oh, bless me now, my Savior!
I come to Thee.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: I Need Jesus
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: George O. Webster
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: I need Jesus, my need I now confess;
No friend like Him in times of deep distress;
I need Jesus, the need I gladly own;
Tho' some may bear their load alone, Yet I need Jesus.
v2: I need Jesus, I need a friend like Him,
A friend to guide when paths of life are dim;
I need Jesus, when foes my soul assail;
Alone I know I can but fail, So I need Jesus.
v3: I need Jesus, I need Him to the end;
No one like Him, He is the sinner's friend;
I need Jesus, no other friend will do;
So constant, kind, so strong and true, Yes, I need Jesus.
c1: I need Jesus, I need Jesus,
I need Jesus every day;
Need Him in the sunshine hour,
Need Him when the storm-clouds low'r;
Every day along my way, Yes, I need Jesus.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: O Blessed, Living Lord
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: George W. Frazer
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: O blessed, living Lord,
Engage our hearts with Thee,
And strike within some answ'ring chord
To love so rich and free!
v2: To know Thy loving heart!
To cleave to Thy blest side;
To gaze upon Thee where Thou art,
And in Thy love abide!
v3: To walk with Thee below!
To learn Thy holy ways;
And more to Thine own stature grow,
To Thine eternal praise!
v4: Thyself our one Desire!
Thyself our Object here;
The goal to which our hearts aspire—
To meet Thee in the air!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Love Divine, All Loves Excelling
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Charles Wesley
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Love Divine, all loves excelling,
Joy of heav'n, to earth come down;
Fix in us Thy humble dwelling,
All Thy faithful mercies crown.
Jesus, Thou art all compassion;
Pure, unbounded love Thou art;
Visit us with Thy salvation,
Enter every trembling heart.
v2: Breathe, O breathe Thy loving Spirit
Into every troubled breast;
Let us all in Thee inherit,
Let us find the promised rest.
Take away our bent to sinning;
Alpha and Omega be;
End of faith, as its beginning,
Set our hearts at liberty.
v3: Come, Almighty, to deliver,
Let us all Thy life receive;
Suddenly return, and never,
Never more Thy temples leave.
Thee we would be always blessing,
Serve Thee as Thy hosts above,
Pray and praise Thee without ceasing,
Glory in Thy perfect love.
v4: Finish, then, Thy new creation;
Pure and spotless let us be;
Let us see Thy great salvation
Perfectly restored in Thee;
Changed from glory into glory
Till with Thee we take our place,
Till we cast our crowns before Thee,
Lost in wonder, love and praise.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: He Is Thy Life
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Frances R. Havergal
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Jesus, Thy life is mine,
Dwell evermore in me;
And let me see
That nothing can untwine
Thy life from mine.
v2: Thy life in me be shown,
Lord, I would hence forth seek
To think and speak
Thy thoughts, Thy words alone,
No more my own.
v3: Thy love, Thy joy, Thy peace,
Continuously impart
Unto my heart,
Fresh springs that never cease,
But still increase.
v4: The blest reality
Of resurrection pow'r,
Thy Church's dower,
Life more abundantly,
Lord, give to me.
v5: Thy fullest gift, O Lord,
Now at Thy word I claim,
Through Thy dear Name,
And touch the rapturous chord
Of praise forth-poured.
v6: Jesus, my life is Thine,
And evermore shall be
Hidden in Thee,
For nothing can untwine
Thy life from mine.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Close To Thee
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Fanny J. Crosby
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Thou my everlasting Portion,
More than friend or life to me,
All along my pilgrim journey,
Savior, let me walk with Thee.
Close to Thee, close to Thee,
Close to Thee, close to Thee;
All along my pilgrim journey,
Savior, let me walk with Thee.
v2: Not for ease or worldly pleasure,
Not for fame my prayer shall be;
Gladly will I toil and suffer,
Only let me walk with Thee.
Close to Thee, close to Thee,
Close to Thee, close to Thee;
Gladly will I toil and suffer,
Only let me walk with Thee.
v3: Lead me through the vale of shadows,
Bear me o'er life's fitful sea;
Then the gate of life eternal
May I enter, Lord, with Thee.
Close to Thee, close to Thee,
Close to Thee, close to Thee;
Then the gate of life eternal
May I enter, Lord, with Thee.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: More Love To Thee, O Christ
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Elizabeth Payson Prentiss
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: More love to Thee, O Christ,
More love to Thee!
Hear Thou the prayer I make
On bended knee;
This is my earnest plea:
More love, O Christ, to Thee,
More love to Thee,
More love to Thee!
v2: Once earthly joy I craved,
Sought peace and rest;
Now Thee alone I seek,
Give what is best;
This all my prayer shall be:
More love, O Christ, to Thee,
More love to Thee,
More love to Thee!
v3: Let sorrow do its work,
Send grief and pain;
Sweet are Thy messengers,
Sweet their refrain,
When they can sing with me,
More love, O Christ, to Thee,
More love to Thee,
More love to Thee!
v4: Then shall my latest breath
Whisper Thy praise;
This be the parting cry
My heart shall raise;
This still its prayer shall be:
More love, O Christ, to Thee,
More love to Thee,
More love to Thee!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Nothing Between
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Charles A. Tindley
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Nothing between my soul and the Savior,
Naught of this world's delusive dream;
I have renounced all sinful pleasure;
Jesus is mine, there's nothing between.
v2: Nothing between, like worldly pleasure;
Habits of life, though harmless they seem,
Must not my heart from Him e'er sever;
He is my all, there's nothing between.
v3: Nothing between, like pride or station;
Self-life or friends shall not intervene;
Though it may cost me much tribulation,
I am resolved; there's nothing between.
v4: Nothing between, e'en many hard trials,
Though the whole world against me convene;
Watching with prayer and much self-denial,
I'll triumph at last, there's nothing between.
c1: Nothing between my soul and the Savior,
So that His blessed face may be seen;
Nothing preventing the least of His favor,
Keep the way clear! Let nothing between.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Thou Magnet Of My Soul!
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Margaret E. Barber
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Thou Magnet of my soul!
Let me come nearer, till
The life of self pulsates no more,
But is forever still.
v2: Thou Sunshine of my heart!
Fill Thou each crevice there,
And let Thy garden yield to Thee
A fragrance sweet and rare.
v3: Thou Ransomer from death!
Possess Thy ransomed one:
Appropriate to Thine own use
The spoil that Thou hast won.
v4: Thou Lord of Life and Light!
I bow beneath Thy sway,
And count it holy privilege
Thy precepts to obey.
v5: Thou Gift unspeakable!
Straight from God's heart of love;
I break my heart to give Thee room
And thus Thy sweetness prove.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Nothing Between, Lord
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Evan H. Hopkins
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7 v8
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Let me Thy glory see,
Draw my soul close to Thee,
Then speak in love to me—
Nothing between, Nothing between.
v2: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Let not earth's din and noise
Stifle Thy still small voice;
In it let me rejoice—
Nothing between, Nothing between.
v3: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Nothing of earthly care,
Nothing of tear or prayer,
No robe that self may wear—
Nothing between, Nothing between.
v4: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Unbelief disappear,
Vanish each doubt and fear,
Fading when Thou art near—
Nothing between, Nothing between.
v5: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Shine with unclouded ray,
Chasing each mist away,
O'er my whole heart bear sway—
Nothing between, Nothing between.
v6: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Thus may I walk with Thee,
Thee only may I see,
Thine only let me be—
Nothing between, Nothing between.
v7: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Till Thine eternal light,
Rising on earth's dark night,
Bursts on my open sight—
Nothing between, Nothing between.
v8: Nothing between, Lord, nothing between;
Till, the last conflict o'er,
I stand on Canaan's shore
With Thee for evermore—
Nothing between, Nothing between.

v1: O Bread to pilgrims given,
O Food for saints to eat,
O Manna sent from heaven,
For heav'n-born natures meet;
Give us, for Thee long pining,
To eat till richly filled;
Till, earth's delights resigning,
Our every wish is stilled.
v2: O Water, life bestowing,
Forth from the Savior's heart,
A fountain purely flowing,
A fount of love Thou art.
Oh, let us, freely tasting,
Our burning thirst assuage;
Thy sweetness, never wasting,
Avails from age to age.
v3: Jesus, this feast receiving,
We Thee unseen adore;
Thy faithful word believing,
We take, and doubt no more.
Give us, Thou true and loving,
On earth to live in Thee;
Then, death the veil removing,
Thy glorious face to see.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: More About Jesus
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Eliza Edmunds Hewitt
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: More about Jesus would I know,
More of His grace to others show;
More of His saving fulness see,
More of His love who died for me.
v2: More about Jesus let me learn,
More of His holy will discern;
Spirit of God my teacher be,
Showing the things of Christ to me.
v3: More about Jesus; in His Word,
Holding communion with my Lord;
Hearing His voice in every line,
Making each faithful saying mine.
v4: More about Jesus; on His throne,
Riches in glory all His own;
More of His kingdom's sure increase;
More of His coming, Prince of Peace.
c1: More, more about Jesus,
More, more about Jesus;
More of His saving fulness see,
More of His love who died for me.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: My Jesus, As Thou Wilt
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Benjamin Schmolck, Jane L. Borthwick
Songs and Hymns of Life.music: from 'Der Freischutz' by Carl M. von Weber, arr. by Hubert P. Main

v1: My Jesus, as Thou wilt!
Oh, may Thy will be mine!
Into Thy hand of love
I would my all resign;
Through sorrow, or through joy,
Conduct me as Thine own,
And help me still to say,
My Lord, Thy will be done!
v2: My Jesus, as Thou wilt!
Though seen through many a tear,
Let not my star of hope
Grow dim or disappear;
Since Thou on earth hast wept,
And sorrowed oft alone,
If I must weep with Thee,
My Lord, Thy will be done!
v3: My Jesus, as Thou wilt!
All shall be well for me;
Each changing future scene
I gladly trust with Thee.
Straight to Thy rest above
I travel calmly on,
And sing, in life or death,
My Lord, Thy will be done!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: I Am Thine, O Lord
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Fanny J. Crosby
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: I am Thine, O Lord, I have heard Thy voice,
And it told Thy love to me;
But I long to rise in the arms of faith,
And be closer drawn to Thee.
v2: Consecrate me now to Thy service, Lord,
By the pow'r of grace divine;
Let my soul look up with a steadfast hope,
And my will be lost in Thine.
v3: O the pure delight of a single hour
That before Thy throne I spend,
When I kneel in prayer, and with Thee, my God,
I commune as friend with friend!
v4: There are depths of love that I yet may know
Ere Thee face to face I see;
There are heights of joy that I yet may reach
Ere I rest in peace with Thee.
c1: Draw me nearer, nearer, blessed Lord,
To the cross where Thou hast died;
Draw me nearer, nearer, nearer, blessed Lord,
To Thy precious, bleeding side.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Be Thou Supreme
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: J. Temperley Grey
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Be Thou supreme, O Jesus Christ,
Nor creed, nor form, nor word,
Nor holy church, nor human love,
Compare with Thee, my Lord!
v2: Be Thou supreme, O Jesus Christ,
Thy love has conquered me;
Beneath Thy cross I die to self,
And live alone to Thee.
v3: Be Thou supreme, O Jesus Christ,
My inmost being fill;
So shall I think as Thou dost think,
And will as Thou dost will.
v4: Be Thou supreme, O Jesus Christ,
Thy life transfigure mine;
And through this veil of mortal flesh,
Lord, let Thy splendor shine.
v5: Be Thou supreme, O Jesus Christ,
My soul exults in Thee;
To be Thy slave, to do Thy will,
Is my felicity.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Jesus, Savior, Pilot Me
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Edward Hopper
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Jesus, Savior, pilot me
Over life's tempestuous sea;
Unknown waves before me roll,
Hiding rock and treach'rous shoal;
Chart and compass come from Thee;
Jesus, Savior, pilot me.
v2: As a mother stills her child,
Thou canst hush the ocean wild;
Boist'rous waves obey Thy will
When Thou say'st to them, "Be still!"
Wondrous Sov'reign of the sea,
Jesus, Savior, pilot me.
v3: When at last I near the shore,
And the fearful breakers roar
'Twixt me and the peaceful rest—
Then, while leaning on Thy breast,
May I hear Thee say to me,
"Fear not, I will pilot thee."

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Hold Thou My Hand
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Fanny J. Crosby
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Hold Thou my hand; so weak I am, and helpless;
I dare not take one step without Thy aid.
Hold Thou my hand: for then, O loving Savior,
No dread of ill shall make my soul afraid.
v2: Hold Thou my hand, and closer, closer draw me
To Thy dear self, my hope, my joy, my all;
Hold Thou my hand: lest haply I should wander,
And missing Thee, my trembling feet should fall.
v3: Hold Thou my hand; the way is dark before me
Without the sunlight of Thy face divine;
But when by faith I catch its radiant glory,
What heights of joy, what rapturous songs are mine!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Guide Me, O Thou Great Jehovah
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: William Williams, Peter Williams, John Hughes
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Guide me, O Thou great Jehovah,
Pilgrim through this barren land;
I am weak, but Thou art mighty,
Hold me with Thy pow'rful hand;
Bread of heaven, Bread of heaven,
Feed me till I want no more;
Feed me till I want no more.
v2: Open now the crystal fountain,
Whence the healing stream shall flow;
Let the fire and cloudy pillar
Lead me all my journey through;
Strong Deliv'rer, strong Deliv'rer,
Be Thou still my Strength and Shield,
Be Thou still my Strength and Shield.
v3: Lord, I trust Thy mighty power,
Wondrous are Thy works of old;
Thou deliver'st Thine from thralldom,
Who for naught themselves had sold:
Thou didst conquer, Thou didst conquer,
Sin, and Satan and the grave,
Sin, and Satan and the grave.
v4: Musing on my habitation,
Musing on my heav'nly home,
Fills my soul with holy longings:
Come, my Jesus, quickly come;
Vanity is all I see;
Lord, I long to be with Thee!
Lord, I long to be with Thee!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: As The Deer
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Martin J. Nystrom
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: As the deer panteth for the water,
so my soul longeth after You.
You alone are my heart's desire
and I long to worship You.
v2: You're my friend and You are my brother
even though You are a King.
I love You more than any other,
so much more than anything.
v3: I want You more than gold or silver,
only You  can satisfy.
You alone are the real joy giver
and the apple of my eye.
c1: You alone are my strength, my shield;
To You alone may my spirit yield.
You alone are my heart`s desire and I long to worship You.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Be Thou My Vision
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Dallan Forgaill, Mary E. Byrne, Eleanor H. Hull
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Be Thou my Vision, O Lord of my heart;
Naught be all else to me, Save that Thou art.
Thou my best Thought by day or by night,
Waking or sleeping, Thy presence my light.
v2: Be Thou my Wisdom, and Thou my true Word;
I ever with you and you with me, Lord;
Thou my great Father and I Thy true son,
Thou in me dwelling, and I with Thee one.
v3: Be Thou my battle Shield, Sword for the fight;
Be Thou my Dignity, Thou my Delight;
Thou my soul's shelter, Thou my high tower;
Raise Thou me heav'enward, O pow'r of my pow'r.
v4: Riches I heed not, nor man's empty praise;
Thou mine Inheritance, now and always;
Thou and Thou only first in my heart,
High King of heaven, my treasure Thou art.
v5: High King of heaven, my victory won,
May I reach heaven's joys, O bright heav'n's Sun!
Heart of my own heart, whatever befall,
Still be my Vision, O Ruler of all.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Experience Of Love
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Titus Chu
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: O Jesus Lord, how I wish to depart,
I am so vile and weak;
And why Beloved, is Your hand stayed on me
when in darkness I stay?
In Your love, so wonderful and marvelous,
I can see no shadow turning there.
In Your love, so wonderful and marvelous,
I can see no shadow turning there.
v2: O Jesus Lord, how can I follow You,
all around is a maze;
And Jesus Lord, how can I forward go;
where is Your footprint clear?
Is there reason why I still can see Your face,
with my failings, and such pow'rlessness?
Is there reason why I still can see Your face,
with my failings, and such pow'rlessness?
v3: O Jesus Lord, let me part from this way,
it is frightfully dark;
And Jesus Lord, hide Your face from me now,
everywhere I'm perplexed.
Yet You search my inmost being thoroughly,
Still You see I long to be with You;
Yet You search my inmost being thoroughly,
Still You see I long to be with You.
v4: O Jesus Lord, lead me now to abide.
You're the fountain of love;
And Jesus, lead me to walk all the way;
You are my true delight.
Though I want to leave You, running far away,
Yet I know that truly I'm in You;
Though I want to leave You, running far away,
Yet I know that truly I'm in You.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Abide With Me
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Henry F. Lyte
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: Abide with me! Fast falls the eventide;
The darkness deepens; Lord, with me abide!
When other helpers fail, and comforts flee,
Help of the helpless, O, abide with me!
v2: Swift to its close ebbs out life's little day;
Earth's joys grow dim, its glories pass away.
Change and decay in all around I see;
O Thou, who changest not, abide with me!
v3: Come not in terrors, as the King of kings;
But kind and good, with healing in Thy wings:
Tears for all woes, a heart for every plea;
Come, Friend of sinners, and abide with me!
v4: I need Thy presence every passing hour:
What but Thy grace can foil the tempter's power?
Who like Thyself my guide and stay can be?
Through cloud and sunshine, O, abide with me!
v5: I fear no foe, with Thee at hand to bless:
Ills have no weight, and tears no bitterness:
Where is death's sting? Where, grave, thy victory?
I triumph still, if Thou abide with me!
v6: Reveal Thyself before my closing eyes;
Shine through the gloom, and point me to the skies:
Heaven's morning breaks, and earth's vain shadows flee;
In life, in death, O Lord, abide with me!

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: I Am The Lord's!
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Lucy A. Bennett
Songs and Hymns of Life.theme: Experiences on the Journey of Life

v1: I am the Lord's! O joy beyond expression,
O sweet response to voice of love Divine;
Faith's joyous "Yes" to the assuring whisper,
"Fear not! I have redeemed thee; thou art Mine."
v2: I am the Lord's! It is the glad confession
Wherewith the Bride recalls the happy day,
When love's "I will" accepted Him forever,
"The Lord's," to love, to honor and obey.
v3: I am the Lord's! Yet teach me all it meaneth,
All it involves of love and loyalty,
Of holy service, absolute surrender,
And unreserved obedience unto Thee.
v4: I am the Lord's! Yes; body, soul, and spirit,
O seal them irrecoverably Thine;
As Thou, Beloved, in Thy grace and fulness
Forever and forevermore art mine.

v1: O Jesus, I have promised
To serve Thee to the end;
Be Thou forever near me,
My Master and my Friend;
I shall not fear the battle
If Thou art by my side,
Nor wander from the pathway
If Thou wilt be my guide.
v2: O let me feel Thee near me,
The world is ever near;
I see the sights that dazzle,
The tempting sounds I hear;
My foes are ever near me,
Around me and within;
But, Jesus, draw Thou nearer,
And shield my soul from sin.
v3: O let me hear Thee speaking
In accents clear and still;
Above the storms of passion,
The murmurs of self-will:
O speak to reassure me,
To hasten or control;
O speak, and make me listen,
Thou guardian of my soul.
v4: O Jesus, Thou hast promised
To all who follow Thee
That where Thou art in glory
There shall Thy servant be;
And, Jesus, I have promised
To serve Thee to the end;
O give me grace to follow,
My Master and my Friend.
v5: O let me see Thy footmarks,
And in them plant mine own;
My hope to follow duly
Is in Thy strength alone.
O guide me, call me, draw me,
Uphold me to the end;
And then to rest receive me,
My Savior and my Friend.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: I Belong To Jesus
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: M. Fraser
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7

v1: I belong to Jesus;
I am not my own;
All I have and all I am
Shall be His alone.
v2: I belong to Jesus;
He is Lord and King,
Reigning in my inmost heart
Over everything.
v3: I belong to Jesus;
What can hurt or harm,
When He folds around my soul
His almighty arm?
v4: I belong to Jesus;
Blessed, blessed thought!
With His own most precious blood
Has my soul been bought.
v5: I belong to Jesus;
He has died for me;
I am His and He is mine
Through eternity.
v6: I belong to Jesus;
He will keep my soul,
If the deathly waters dark
Round about me roll.
v7: I belong to Jesus;
And ere long I'll be
With my precious Savior there
In His royalty.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Thy Life Was Given For Me
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Frances R. Havergal
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

v1: Thy life was giv'n for me,
Thy blood, O Lord, was shed,
That I might ransomed be,
And quickened from the dead;
Thy Life was given for me, for me;
What have I given for Thee?
v2: Long years were spent for me
In weariness and woe,
That through eternity
Thy glory I might know;
Long years were spent for me, for me;
Have I spent one for Thee?
v3: Thy Father's home of light,
Thy rainbow-circled throne,
Were left for earthly night,
For wand'rings sad and lone;
Yea, all was left for me, for me;
Have I left aught for Thee?
v4: Thou, Lord, hast borne for me
More than my tongue can tell
Of bitt'rest agony,
To rescue me from hell;
Thou suff'redst all for me, for me;
What have I borne for Thee?
v5: And Thou hast brought to me
Down from Thy home above,
Salvation full and free,
Thy pardon and Thy love;
Great gifts, great gifts Thou broughtest me;
What have I brought to Thee?
v6: Oh, let my life be given,
My years for Thee be spent;
World-fetters all be riven,
And joy with suff'ring blent;
Thou gav'st Thyself for me, for me,
I give myself to Thee.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Take My Life, And Let It Be
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Frances R. Havergal
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

v1: Take my life, and let it be
Consecrated, Lord, to Thee.
Take my moments and my days,
Let them flow in ceaseless praise,
Let them flow in ceaseless praise.
v2: Take my hands, and let them move
At the impulse of Thy love.
Take my feet and let them be
Swift and beautiful for Thee,
Swift and beautiful for Thee.
v3: Take my voice, and let me sing
Always, only, for my King.
Take my lips, and let them be
Filled with messages from Thee,
Filled with messages from Thee.
v4: Take my silver and my gold;
Not a mite would I withhold.
Take my intellect, and use
Every pow'r as Thou shalt choose,
Every pow'r as Thou shalt choose.
v5: Take my will, and make it Thine;
It shall be no longer mine.
Take my heart; it is Thine own;
It shall be Thy royal throne,
It shall be Thy royal throne.
v6: Take my love; my Lord, I pour
At Thy feet its treasure-store.
Take myself, and I will be
Ever, only, all for Thee,
Ever, only, all for Thee.

v1: Lord, Thou hast won, at length I yield;
My heart by mighty grace compelled
Surrenders all to Thee;
Against Thy terrors long I strove,
But who can stand against Thy love?
Love conquers even me.
v2: But since Thou hast Thy love revealed,
And shown my soul a pardon sealed,
I can resist no more:
Could'st Thou for such a sinner bleed?
Can'st Thou for such a rebel plead?
I wonder and adore!
v3: If Thou hadst bid Thy thunders roll,
And light'nings flash, to blast my soul,
I still had stubborn been;
But mercy has my heart subdued,
A bleeding Savior I have viewed,
And now I hate my sin.
v4: Now, Lord, I would be Thine alone,
Come, take possession of Thine own,
For Thou hast set me free;
Released from Satan's hard command,
See all my powers waiting stand,
To be employed by Thee.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: O Love, That Will Not Let Me Go
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: George Matheson

v1: O Love, that will not let me go,
I rest my weary soul in Thee;
I give Thee back the life I owe,
That in Thine ocean depths its flow
May richer, fuller be.
v2: O Light, that followest all my way,
I yield my flickering torch to Thee;
My heart restores its borrowed ray,
That in Thy sunshine's blaze its day
May brighter, fairer be.
v3: O Joy, that seekest me through pain,
I cannot close my heart to Thee;
I trace the rainbow through the rain,
And feel the promise is not vain
That morn shall tear less be.
v4: O Cross, that liftest up my head,
I dare not ask to fly from Thee;
I lay in dust life's glory dead,
And from the ground there blossoms red
Life that shall endless be.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: O, The Bitter Shame And Sorry
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Theodore Monod

v1: O, the bitter shame and sorrow,
That a time could ever be,
When I let the Savior's pity
Plead in vain, and proudly answered,
"All of self, and none of Thee,
All of self, and none of Thee."
v2: Yet He found me; I beheld Him
Bleeding on the cursèd tree;
Heard Him pray, "Forgive them, Father!"
And my wistful heart said faintly,
"Some of self, and some of Thee,
Some of self, and some of Thee."
v3: Day by day His tender mercy,
Healing, helping, full and free,
Sweet and strong, and ah! so patient,
Brought me lower while I whispered,
"Less of self, and more of Thee,
Less of self, and more of Thee."
v4: Higher than the highest heavens,
Deeper than the deepest sea,
Lord, Thy love at last hath conquered;
Grant me now my heart's petition,
"None of self, and all of Thee,
None of self, and all of Thee."

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Hast Thou Heart Him?
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Ora Rowan
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1 v6 c1 v7 c1

v1: Hast thou heard Him, seen Him, known Him?
Is not thine a captured heart?
Chief among ten thousand own Him;
Joyful choose the better part.
v2: Idols once they won thee, charmed thee,
Lovely things of time and sense;
Gilded thus does sin disarm thee,
Honeyed lest thou turn thee thence.
v3: What has stripped the seeming beauty
From the idols of the earth?
Not a sense of right or duty,
But the sight of peerless worth.
v4: Not the crushing of those idols,
With its bitter void and smart;
But the beaming of His beauty,
The unveiling of His heart.
v5: Who extinguishes their taper
Till they hail the rising sun?
Who discards the garb of winter
Till the summer has begun?
v6: 'Tis that look that melted Peter,
'Tis that face that Stephen saw,
'Tis that heart that wept with Mary,
Can alone from idols draw:
v7: Draw and win and fill completely,
Till the cup o'erflow the brim;
What have we to do with idols
Who have companied with Him?
c1: Captivated by His beauty,
Worthy tribute haste to bring;
Let His peerless worth constrain thee,
Crown Him now unrivaled King.

v1: I've turned my back upon the world
With all its idle pleasures,
And set my heart on better things,
On higher, holier treasures;
No more its glitter and its glare,
And vanity shall blind me;
I've crossed the separating line,
And left the world behind me.
Far, far behind me!
Far, far behind me!
I've crossed the separating line,
And left the world behind me.
v2: I've left the old sad life of sin,
Its follies all forsaken;
My standing place is now in Christ,
His holy vows I've taken;
Beneath the standard of the cross
The world henceforth shall find me;
I've passed in Christ from death to life,
And left the world behind me.
Far, far behind me!
Far, far behind me!
I've passed in Christ from death to life,
And left the world behind me.
v3: My soul shall ne'er return again
Back to its former station,
For here alone is perfect peace,
And rest from condemnation;
I've made exchange of masters now,
The vows of glory bind me,
And once for all I've left the world,
Yes, left the world behind me.
Far, far behind me!
Far, far behind me!
And once for all I've left the world,
Yes, left the world behind me.
v4: My choice is made forevermore,
I want no other Savior;
I ask no purer happiness
Than His sweet love and favor;
My heart is fixed on Jesus Christ,
No more the world shall blind me;
I've crossed the Red Sea of His death,
And left the world behind me.
Far, far behind me!
Far, far behind me!
I've crossed the Red Sea of His death,
And left the world behind me.

Songs and Hymns of Life.title: Utterly Abandoned
Songs and Hymns of Life.author: Unknown
Songs and Hymns of Life.presentation: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1 v6 c1 v7 c1

v1: Utterly abandoned
To the Holy Ghost!
Seeking all His fulness
At whatever cost;
Cutting all the shorelines,
Launching in the deep
Of His mighty power,
Strong to save and keep.
v2: Utterly abandoned
To the Holy Ghost!
Oh! the sinking, sinking,
Till the self is lost!
Till the vessel's emptied
Broken at His feet;
Waiting till His filling
Makes the work complete.
v3: Utterly abandoned
To the will of God;
Walking in the pathway
That my Master trod;
Leaving ease and pleasure,
Making Him my choice,
Waiting for His guidance,
List'ning for His voice.
v4: Utterly abandoned!
Through eternity;
My will never choosing,
His it e'er shall be;
All my plans and longings
